byline.contributor: Michael M. Grynbaum and Ashley Southall contributed reporting.
byline.original: By LIZ ROBBINS and AL BAKER

abstract: New York City Police investigate claim by retired tennis pro James Blake, who says he was thrown to ground and handcuffed by officers who mistook him for suspect as he was leaving midtown hotel on way to appearance at United States Open; Blake, who is biracial, says race was likely factor in incident, but that such force should not be used against anyone.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Blake, in New York for the United States Open, said he was pushed outside a Manhattan hotel by the police and handcuffed after being mistaken for a suspect in a fraud case.

headline.main: James Blake, Retired Tennis Pro, Says Police Pushed Him Down; Inquiry Is Opened
headline.print_headline: Police Are Investigating Retired Tennis Pro’s Claims of Unnecessary Force

snippet: Mr. Blake, in New York for the United States Open, said he was pushed outside a Manhattan hotel by the police and handcuffed after being mistaken for a suspect in a fraud case.
